licensing: Do not copy proprietary text; author original summaries.
privacy: Do not include secrets or personal data in RoC compliance reports.
safety: Do not overwrite existing RoC compliance reports.
Reject context and session_id values containing path separators or dot-segments.

acceptance_criteria: Creates a RoC compliance report under runtime/contexts/<context>/audits/roc/.
Flags violations when forbidden tools are used or approvals are missing.
Logs a U.Work record when telemetry/log-work is available.

failure_modes: Invalid context or session_id value (not a safe path segment).
Failed to write the RoC compliance report.

inputs.description: Bounded context name used to locate runtime/contexts/<context> (must be a safe path segment).
inputs.name: context

inputs.description: Session identifier to check (safe path segment).
inputs.name: session_id

inputs.description: Path to the RoC YAML file.
inputs.name: roc_path

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of used tools.
inputs.name: used_tools

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of approval keys satisfied.
inputs.name: approvals

inputs.description: Optional agent type performing the RoC check.
inputs.name: agent_type

inputs.description: Optional RoleAssignment label used when logging U.Work (default: ProxyAuditor).
inputs.name: role_assignment

inputs.description: Optional semicolon-delimited list of related DRR ids or paths.
inputs.name: decisions

inputs.description: Optional ISO-8601 timestamp_start override (used for deterministic testing).
inputs.name: timestamp_start

intent.goal: Check session activity against a Rule of Constraints policy and record compliance status.
non_goals: Does not enforce actions or approvals.

name: Check RoC Compliance

outputs.description: Path to the generated RoC compliance report markdown file.
outputs.name: roc_report_path

procedure.instruction: Validate required inputs (context, session_id, roc_path) and ensure safe path segments.
Load the RoC file and parse permissions, approvals, and escalation policy.
Compare used tools and approvals to the RoC requirements and collect violations.
Write a RoC compliance report with status and violations.
If telemetry/log-work is available, log the compliance check with agent metadata when provided.

summary: Checks session compliance against a Rule of Constraints policy.
